comments:
Build ID: I20070323-1616

Steps To Reproduce:
I'm using EMF 2.3.0.v200704050200.

1. Follow the instructions at http://help.eclipse.org/help32/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.jet.doc/tasks/usingJetWithEMF.xhtml
2. Run a JET Transformation using an ecore Model as input.
3. Observe the dialog coming up with an internal error. The log output is below.

I added the project "org.eclipse.emf.ecore" to the project dependencies, but it didn't help. It seems JET launcher uses another classpath, where it cannot find org.eclipse.emf.ecore.


More information:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-04-05 17:04:38.312
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Launching W2-JET".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/emf/ecore/EClassifier
        at org.eclipse.jet.compiled._jet_main.generate(_jet_main.java:102)
        at org.eclipse.jet.transform.TransformContextExtender.execute(TransformContextExtender.java:147)
        at org.eclipse.jet.transform.TransformContextExtender.execute(TransformContextExtender.java:120)
        at org.eclipse.jet.JET2Platform$4.run(JET2Platform.java:449)
        at org.eclipse.jet.internal.runtime.JETBundleManager.run(JETBundleManager.java:331)
        at org.eclipse.jet.JET2Platform.runTransform(JET2Platform.java:417)
        at org.eclipse.jet.internal.launch.JETProcess.run(JETProcess.java:157)
        at org.eclipse.jet.internal.launch.JET2TransformationDelegate.launch(JET2TransformationDelegate.java:60)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:766)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:608)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:911)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$7.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:1114)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

This, of course, works on my machine :-(

JET is using the standard Eclipse/OSGi bundle loader to load the JET project - there should be no difference from any other plug-in.

The message you are getting is consistent with not having org.eclipse.emf.ecore in your dependencies list, and running the transformation in spite of the compiler error. Are you should you saved the modified plug-in manifest?
Resolving as works for me. If you can provide more information, or a test case, please re-open.
